description: Primes p such that phi(x) = p-1 has only 2 solutions, namely x = p and x = 2p.
comments: Two solutions, p and 2p, exist for all odd primes p; primes in sequence have no other solutions.
example: For p=2, Phi[x]=1 has only two solutions, but they are 1 and 2, not 2 and 4, so 2 is not in the sequence.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Dec 14 2000
